intro: Euchaetis intonsa, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of eastern North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy, seed-bearing structures. Euchaetis intonsa is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
